author: quirin.schlegel
title: Cardano Script Explorer 🔎📜
description: There is currently no Cardano Blockchain Explorer, that focuses on script data.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal offers to create a cardano blockchain explorer that focuses on script data, using the blockfrost API.
This proposal meets the challenge objective, but no elements are provided to assess how impactful it can be on Cardano Blockfrost ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The author claims a experience in development but hardly provide evidence (except a github repos, whose I haven't been able to assess the quality/difficulty). I would recommend to elaborate examples of past realisation. 
The proposal lacks essential details. Even if the requested budget is low (600 USD), additional information like an estimation of the work load or a development plan are needed elements to give a higher feasibility score.
Two deliverables are mentionned, but no details on the deliverable (not even a name) is given.
f6_assessments.q2:
Regarding auditability, this proposal lacks many details. 2 rows and 2 milestones does not make a detailed enough timeline. 
"Number of Users and Requests" doe not enable the community to track progress in the project development. I would recommend to offer the community regular development update and to confirm that the project will be open source.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal does mention that Cardano doesn't have a Cardano Blockchain Explorer at the moment, but I haven't really seen the solution you've outlined with enough information included to really understand what it is and how you would go about it. building on it to help Cardano grow more, solutions for future expansion and a specific plan for implementation
What from the proposal is just that it will be easier for people to do something but what it is needs to be more detailed and clear and not just an idea
f6_assessments.q1:
The writer of the proposal has mentioned the experience of using programming languages, but for the project to be really feasible, it is necessary to prepare more than that.
The information that the proposal provider can refer to make the proposal clearer: Current and future performance, documents and links, complete evidence, member information joining the project with practical experience, experience in blockchain/crypto, websites or transparent personal image - this is very important, Project implementation time should also be detailed by weeks, months, items to do, Amount to be broken down into items, clear allocation, more technical aspects, and risk factors. Hope the above information will help the solution provider to have a clearer proposal in the future
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditing is an important issue for a funded project, so the proposal should clarify the Roadmap to be done, the milestones to be achieved, the time to achieve the corresponding results, and the specific KPIs to be tracked. more than simply measuring the number of people in general, and finally a public channel for everyone to access and check the progress of the project.
The above will help the team themselves and interested people can understand the process, making it more transparent

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement of this proposal is very clear and straightforward, that there is currently no Cardano Blockchain Explorer that focuses on script data.
The solution in the proposal is to use Blockfrost API to set up a simple UI to browse Blockfrost API to set up a simple UI to browse script data. The aim of the proposer is to write a Frontend, which will run locally so that a user can log in with their Blockfrost account and browse script data. 
To address the challenge, the proposer mentioned that this proposal will make Blockfrost more accessible to many people.
This is part of the objectives of the challenge but the proposer should have expanded it to the effect on Cardano.
The only risk mentioned is that he is time-constrained, but to mitigate this, he says he will split up his idea into two deliverables and the second one will be optional.
The challenge is addressed to some little effect. The proposer did not mention how much Cardano will be effected to well address the challenge. My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
As we expect a detailed plan for the proposal, there is mention of a brief plan stating only two timelines - 3 months for local Frontend and 2 months for Hosted Frontend. This is very limited to make the project feasible. 
The total budget requested is $600 which I think is not adequate for the development of an API. The breakdown has only two items for $100 for each making a total of $200, which does not match the total of $600. This again is not detailed enough.
The proposer's name is mentioned as Quirin Schlegel, who is a student at TU Berlin, and has learned HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and others. He says he is a full stack developer. His GitHub link is provided for reference. 
He mentioned that he will come back to request more from Catalyst if the project is used enough. He said in the proposal that he is involved in other proposals in Fund 9.
I think this project needs a team of experts so I advise that the proposer find a few experts in Blockfrost to collaborate with to do a good job. My rating is 2.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer mentioned only one metric to measure progress, that is the number of users and requests, Details should have been provided about where to track progress, that is progress reports to IOG, on google sheets, etc. 
The success of the project is also briefly stated as a Frontend, which people can use to track, find and control scripts on Cardano Blockchain. 
The proposer has been very very brief, not giving enough information to back the project. 
The information provided is not enough to audit the progress and success of the proposal. My rating is 2

f6_assessments.q0: The main idea of this proposal is to build an UI to browse script which in turn would make Blockfrost more accessible. Unfortunately, this proposal is too succinct and does not explain in more detail how it will be done. In other words, the proposer has identified an aspect that could be potentially improved in the Blockfrost ecosystem but has not explained clearly how it will operate both from a user perspective and from a developing perspective. That is, the proposer could have articulated better how the solution will add value to the Cardano environment. The only metrics provided are number of users and requests. Even though they align with the challenge goals I would also add a metric related to the acquisition of users (it could be done through a small survey launched in the UI to understand if the users are new to Blockfrost and Cardano).
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims to have experience in front end development but has not provided a LinkedIn profile or any similar source to back that up. He does provide a GitHub link but the number of contributions so far is very limited. It is a simple project and thus will only require one person. My suggestion would be for the proposer to add a description of his skills and past experiences in the feasibility section. The section is entitled "Please provide details of the people who will work on the project" which was not given. Even though there is information in the general section about his experiences it is better to err on the side of redundancy than of lack of information and transparency. The total amount requested is reasonable but again, further explanation could have been given to enhance the clarity of the proposal. It is not written down where the USD 100 per month will be directed to. I assume it would go to the developer but it could have been explicitly stated as well as the number of months and the total amount for this item. Additionally, the timetable is realistic but as the proposer has left the second deliverable as optional, I don't think it should have been included in the budget. Finally, regarding risks they have claimed time constraints is the only risk and have placed the second deliverable as an optional one to mitigate that risk. I believe this is not a real solution to the problem and other risks could have been discussed as well such as the risk of low adoption of the product developed or finding out the amount of work required is way bigger than expected, for example.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided is quite poor. Given the second deliverable is optional, the only information we have is it will take 3 months to conclude the front-end work. The proposer could have broken that down into midway milestones stating at which point in the development he believes the project will be at one month and at two months, for example. The KPIs provided are ok but others could have been added to improve auditability. For instance, number of new users (new to Blockfrost and Cardano environment) and number of contributors could have been defined. Finally, no public channel was provided so the community could be regularly updated on the status of the development of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe Proposer's idea is simple but aligned with the Campaign Brief. If the Proposer successfuly create the first Cardano Script Explorer, surely it can attract more people to Cardano and take a peek on our technology. Proposer also want to store the code on github. With that, devs who interested to improve the Cardano Script Explorer will automatically use the Blockfrost.
f6_assessments.q1: I really don't like Proposer who values his own incentives to work on this project so low. I checked, the lowest salary of Junior Full-Stack Developer on German (because Proposer said he's in Berlin) is 1,640€ while Proposer just ask $600 for 6 months work (by his own!). Overall, the others feasibility point (such as: Timetable and relevant experiences) are clearly understandable, despite Proposer wrote it too simple.
f6_assessments.q2: Only two KPIs on this proposal: Number of Users and Requests. There's one thing to take note about this proposal: as Proposer mentioned the growth of users and requests, the proposal need to add how to reach out / attract people to use this Cardano Script Explorer. Maybe Proposer need to consider or if Proposer already thought about it, Proposer could explain it later.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal directly addresses 3 of the 4 guiding questions of the challenge. Attracting new developers, developers from other blockchains and making Blockfrost more decentralized and robust. 

The proposal is to make an easy, browser-based tool to explore what the Blockfrost /scripts endpoint can provide. Currently, you have to know what you are looking for with Blockfrost. This tool will allow people to explore and interact with the blockchain with no previous experience. It will be attractive to generalist web developers who are thinking about getting into blockchain, as well as experienced blockchain developers who want to explore Cardano with virtually no commitment to learn new tooling. 

This also takes some of the weight of education off of Blockfrost. This is, essentially, decentralization.
f6_assessments.q1:
The developer appears to have the skills, knowledge and desire to build this. 

Time is against this proposal. The developer admits that lack of time is the biggest hurdle. This proposal does not provide enough budget to make this a higher priority. 

This proposes a very useful tool,  but does not ask for enough resources to accomplish it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditing and feasibility section does not provide metrics or goals. It calls for a general assessment of growth of user-base. 

Since this is a brand new project the measurement will start from zero users. 

Given this information, any audit will be imprecise.

f6_assessments.q0: The proponent provided an issue in the Problem Statement that was clear but not concise because when posing the problem there should be a clear purpose of why it is a problem and how this will affect the community. That will answer the question "why do we need a solution to this problem?" Similarly, the proposal's ability to positively impact the community has not been provided, some of the answers give me a vague feeling such as "If I have enough time ", is this a risk? of project. I can understand that he wants to make Blockfrost more accessible to many people which could benefit Cardano, however, this is not a solution. Regarding future scalability, he needs to review what the proposal offers to show the potential of the project.
f6_assessments.q1: Really I hope the writer of the proposal can provide details about the Frontend he wants to write about and what impact it will have on the community so that I can make a more accurate assessment. The writer did not give information about the skills or experience of the project participants, he mentioned "full stack developer" but it would be better if there is evidence. The proposal has a request of $100 per month, the proposal writer needs to provide details of the budget to be paid for which items. The proposal also lacks a detailed plan, and timetable to complete the work, therefore I disagree with the feasibility of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not provide a roadmap that includes time as well as milestones, the two indicators are the number of users and the requirements may be the right KPIs, but because the information is too sketchy, I can't judge the suitability of the map and surely those 2 metrics are enough to quantify the success of the project. In addition, the writer of the proposal did not mention anyway for the community to track the progress of the project within 5 months that the proposal was implemented.

f6_assessments.q0: The current proposal does not have a specific presentation of the problem to be solved, so the reader cannot clearly see how difficult the current problem is. The solution to the problem is only approximate, not detailed yet. It's not yet clear how this proposal affects Cardano. I also don't see the scaling potential of this proposal. I feel the proposer has not put effort into this proposal. Rating: 1 point
f6_assessments.q1: I found the feasibility of this proposal has no valuable information at all. The timelines section is too sketchy, with no specific activities. The budget allocation section of the proposal also provides no information on the allocation of funds to activities. But based on the absence of specific activities, of course the budget allocation cannot be completed either. The proposal then provides the reader with no information or proof as to whether the implementer is sufficiently qualified to implement the proposal, all that the proposal is just a name for. The proposal also does not yet outline the risk and how to limit it. Rating: 1 point
f6_assessments.q2: This auditability section does not provide any information about KPIs or milestones. The way the proposer controls the execution of the project is also very sketchy, making it impossible to succeed with these methods. And of course, there is also no way for the community to track completion progress or spend allocation. I strongly disagree with proposals like this. Rating: 1 point

solution: I want to use the Blockfrost api to set up a simple UI to browse script data.
experience:
I am a student at TU Berlin, where I learned HTML, CSS, Java Script, VUEjs and more.
I have sufficient Experience as a full stack Developer.
